text: The Rubzewitz Ghetto was a Nazi ghetto which was established in German- occupied Poland and which held and exterminated Polish-born Jews. The ghetto was located in the Polish village of Rubzewitz, German-occupied Poland (modern-day Rubiezewicze, Republic of Belarus). The ghetto was liquidated for the final time in the spring of 1942, with all of it's inhabitants being transported to other ghettos or labor camps (most of the inhabitants were sent to Camp Dwortz). Category:Ghettos
title: Rubzewitz Ghetto
